titleStmt.title: The shipwrack of all false churches: and the immutable safety and stability of the true Church of Christ. Occasioned: by Doctour Chamberlen his mistake of her, and the holy scriptures also, by syllogising words, to find out spirituall meanings, when in such cases it is the definition, not the name, by which things are truly knowne.
titleStmt.author: Graunt, John, of Bucklersbury.

titleStmt.title: The shipwrack of all false churches: and the immutable safety and stability of the true Church of Christ. Occasioned: by Doctour Chamberlen his mistake of her, and the holy scriptures also, by syllogising words, to find out spirituall meanings, when in such cases it is the definition, not the name, by which things are truly knowne.
titleStmt.author: Graunt, John, of Bucklersbury.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, and are to be sold by G. Calvert, at the West End of Pauls, and J. Hancock in Popes-head-Alley,

notesStmt.note: A reply to an untraced tract by Peter Chamberlen.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
